derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English mōna, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch maan and German Mond, also to month, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin mensis and Greek mēn 'month', and also Latin metiri 'to measure' (the moon being used to measure time)

encyclopedia.content: 奥井亚纪－－《moon》 又名月之茧 TURN A高达 演唱：奥井亚纪 日文歌词： 山の端 月は满ち 息づくあなたの森 夏草浴びて眠る 爱おしい 横颜 おぼろな この星 大地に 银の泪 茧たる蛹达は 七たび身をかえる 青にLaLaLu LaLaLu染まる 恋し茧玉 扬羽の蝶になる やがて空をつつむ 无限の翅模样 命辉かせよ あの月 あなたなら 悲しみを写さずに 世の摇らぎ见つめて 叹かずに飞んでみる 风にLaLaLu LaLaLu呗え 羽根に月うつし 扬羽の蝶

entry.def: The moon is the object that you can often see in the sky at night. It goes round the Earth once every four weeks, and as it does so its appearance changes from a circle to part of a circle.
A moon is an object similar to a small planet that travels around a planet.

entry.tran: 虚度光阴;懒散度日;闲逛
entry.def: If you are mooning around, you are spending time doing nothing in particular, for example because you feel unhappy or lazy, or are worried about something.

example.ex: Lettie was mooning around all  morning, doing nothing...
example.tran: 莱蒂混了一上午，什么也没干。

example.ex: My working days were spent mooning round his department, trying to sneak a chance encounter.
example.tran: 上班时我在他的部门转来转去，暗中寻找巧遇他的机会。

entry.def: If you moon at someone, you turn your back to them and show them your bare bottom.
If you say that something happens once in a blue moon, you are emphasizing that it does not happen very often at all.

example.ex: Once in a blue moon you get some problems.

entry.tran: 非常高兴;乐翻了天;狂喜
entry.def: If you say that you are over the moon, you mean that you are very pleased about something.

means.word_mean: 5. any natural satellite of a planet;
1. have dreamlike musings or fantasies while awake;
2. be idle in a listless or dreamy way

list.explanation: 极为罕见地，难得有一次

example.en: I do this only once in a blue moon.
example.zh: 此事我只是极为偶然而为之。

example.en: Once in a blue moon I have a little wine with dinner.
example.zh: 我难得有一次在吃午饭时喝一点儿酒。

example.en: He gets moon-eyed every Saturday night.
example.zh: 他每星期六晚上都喝得醉眼朦胧的。

Sentence.sentence: In 1961, when President Kennedy declared that America would send a man to the moon by the decade's end, those words, too, had a dreamlike quality.

sentences.en: The moon yields less light than the sun.
sentences.cn: 月亮的光线比太阳的光线弱。

jushi.english: John asked his mother for a hundred dollars today.He was always asking for the moon.
jushi.chinese: 约翰今天向他母亲要100元,他总是异想天开。

jushi.english: Here, under her few square yards of thatch, she watched winds, snows, rains, gorgeous sunsets and successive moons at their full.
jushi.chinese: 在这里,她整天呆在这几平方米大的茅草棚中,守着风风雨雨,望着雪花飘飘,目送灿烂的晚霞,数着一次又一次月圆。
